result.execSummary:
The defendant Tristan T Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.

- Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 
- If defendant pays all court costs, completes his GED, and doesn't get charged with another crime, Court will grant expungement. (Defendant will need to apply). Defendant will need to provide proof of completion of his GED to the Clerk of Courts.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tristan T Beck

defendant.name: Beck, Tristan T
defendant.address: 1438 Maricopa Drive Apt B, Oshkosh, WI 54904

records.addlTxt: Warrant cancelled - Spoke to Michaela from dispatch.
Warrant cancelled - Spoke to Michaela from dispatch.

1:30 PM Defendant Tristan T Beck in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  ADA recites offer - fine and costs and dna sample. Defendant accepts offer. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. 

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. Court quashes warrant.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty as charged. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 
-Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. 
-If def pays all court costs, completes his GED, and doesn't get charged with another crime, Court will grant expungement. Def needs to provide proof of completion of GED.

Court adjourned at 1:38 PM.

Def called and stated he was told he had an active warrant for this case which he didn't know existed. Def requested for the warrant to be taken care of as soon as possible. Def's phone number and address were updated. Def opted to receive text message reminders of upcoming court dates. I informed the def I would send him a notice of hearing but he may not receive it in the mail in time. Def was told to be sure he wrote down the court date of May 2, 2022 at 1:00 PM. Def was told the warrant would remain active until he was seen in court.
Initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
